article_text:
Have the reporters covering Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign finally reached the end of their rope? No, but on Independence Day they came close. “Hillary Clinton’s campaign used a rope to keep journalists away from the candidate on Saturday while she walked in this small town’s July Fourth parade,” CNN reports from Gorham, N.H.:

The ensuing photos of journalists, including a CNN reporter, being somewhat dragged by a thin white rope as [Mrs.] Clinton walked down Main Street caught fire online. Initially, Clinton’s campaign was not using a rope to corral the press, allowing journalists to get close to her...

Initially, Clinton’s campaign was not using a rope to corral the press, allowing journalists to get close to her...
Have the reporters covering Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign finally reached the end of their rope?
No, but on Independence Day they came close.
“Hillary Clinton’s campaign used a rope to keep journalists away from the candidate on Saturday while she walked in this small town’s July Fourth parade,” CNN reports from Gorham, N.H.:The ensuing photos of journalists, including a CNN reporter, being somewhat dragged by a thin white rope as [Mrs.] Clinton walked down Main Street caught fire online.
